title: Riza Lushta
text:
Riza Lushta (22 January 1916 – 6 February 1997) was a <a href="Kosovo%20Albanians">Kosovar Albanian</a> <a href="Association%20football">football</a> striker.
Career.
Early career.
Lushta was born on 22 January 1916 in <a href="Mitrovica%2C%20Kosovo">Kosovska Mitrovica</a>, <a href="Kingdom%20of%20Serbia">Kingdom of Serbia</a> (present day Mitrovica, <a href="Kosovo">Kosovo</a>). It was in his hometown that he would begin to play football with the local club <a href="FK%20Trep%C4%8Da">Rudari Trepča</a>, where he quickly established himself as one of the most effective strikers the city and even region had ever seen. After spendin with Rudari Trepča Lushta two years left Kosovo in 1934 and went to Albania to join the <a href="Harry%20Fultz%20Institute">Harry Fultz Technical School</a> in Tirana and in that time he joined two time Albanian champions <a href="KF%20Tirana">SK Tirana</a>. His career with Tirana immediately took off, winning the league title in his first season in Albania, before going on to win it a total of four times between 1934 and 1939, as well as the inaugural <a href="Albanian%20Cup">King's Cup</a> in 1939. He left Albania and SK Tirana in 1939 following the <a href="Italian%20occupation%20of%20Albania">Italian occupation of Albania</a> to join <a href="A.S.%20Bari">Bari</a> in <a href="Italy">Italy</a>, where he scored 3 times in 16 games during his first season in Italy. His performances with Bari attracted the interest of <a href="Juventus%20F.C.">Juventus</a> who he joined in 1940 after just one year with Bari. In his first season with Juventus he scored 9 times in 26 games before netting 15 goals the following season to be named the highest scoring foreigner of the <a href="1941%E2%80%9342%20Serie%20A">1941–42 Serie A</a>.

After a youth start with <a href="FK%20Trep%C4%8Da">FK Rudari Trepča</a>, he started his career at <a href="SK%20Tirana">SK Tirana</a>, and won four Albanian titles with the team (<a href="Kategoria%20superiore%201934">1934</a>, <a href="Kategoria%20superiore%201936">1936</a>, <a href="Kategoria%20superiore%201937">1937</a> and <a href="Kategoria%20superiore%201939">1939</a>, the latter one not recognized by the Albanian Football Association) and the first <a href="Albanian%20Cup">Albanian Cup</a> in 1939.

Eventually he went back to Italy and played with <a href="U.S.%20Alessandria%20Calcio%201912">Alessandria</a>, and then in <a href="Serie%20C">Italian Third Division</a> with <a href="A.C.%20Siena">Siena</a> and in <a href="Serie%20D">Italian Fourth Division</a> with <a href="A.C.%20Forl%C3%AC">Forlì</a>, and the <a href="Rapallo%20Ruentes">Rapallo Ruentes</a>, the team of <a href="Rapallo">Rapallo</a>.
He closed his career in 1954 at 38 years old.
Overall, he played 170 matches in <a href="Serie%20A">Serie A</a>, scoring 68 goals; with Juventus, he played the Italian War Tournament 1943-44 (5 matches and 5 goal scored). He never played for the <a href="Albania%20national%20football%20team">Albania national football team</a>. He died at 80 years old.
In Mitrovica, Kosovo, his birthplace, the <a href="Riza%20Lushta%20Stadium">city stadium</a> currently bears his name.
